meanings.definition: A person who bags groceries at a store.
meanings.sent1: The baggers at the supermarket work quickly to pack groceries.
meanings.sent2: I thanked the baggers for helping me with my shopping bags.
meanings.sent3: The baggers at the store made a game out of who could pack the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The team of baggers filled the bags like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The baggers' efficiency impressed the customers waiting in line.

meanings.definition: A machine used for filling bags with material.
meanings.sent1: The factory installed new baggers to speed up production.
meanings.sent2: The baggers in the warehouse were essential for packaging goods.
meanings.sent3: The baggers in the plant hummed as they filled bags with seeds.
meanings.sent4: The baggers operated smoothly, ensuring no spills or wastage.
meanings.sent5: The baggers' mechanism was simple yet effective in bagging items.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a motorcycle with saddlebags.
meanings.sent1: He rode a cool baggers motorcycle with storage compartments.
meanings.sent2: The baggers bike had enough space for all his travel gear.
meanings.sent3: The baggers motorcycle looked like it was ready for a road trip.
meanings.sent4: The baggers bike roared down the highway, carrying all his belongings.
meanings.sent5: The baggers motorcycle was perfect for long rides with extra storage.
